intro: Asemeia marquesiana, commonly known as the Marquesan asemeia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly the Marquesas Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found growing in coastal forests or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
